data.title: FamousFix.com list
data.text:
1.

Keye Luke

American actor (1904–1991)

Overview: Keye Luke (traditional Chinese: 陸錫麒; simplified Chinese: 陆锡麒; pinyin: Lù Xīqí, Cantonese: Luk Shek Kee; June 18, 1904 – January 12, 1991) was a Chinese-born American film and television actor ...

0 0

2.

Warner Oland

Swedish-American actor (1879–1938)

Overview: Warner Oland (born Johan Verner Ölund, October 3, 1879 – August 6, 1938) was a Swedish-American actor most remembered for playing several Chinese and Chinese-American characters: Dr. Fu Manchu; ...

Date of birth: 3 October 1879

Date of death: 6 August 1938

Age: 58 (age at death)

Nationality: Swedish

Occupation: Actor

Gender: Male

Height: 5' 11" (180 cm)

0 0

The Amazing Chan and the Chan Clan

American animated television series

Overview: The Amazing Chan and the Chan Clan (sometimes abbreviated as The Amazing Chan Clan) is an American animated television series produced by Hanna-Barbera Productions, animated by Eric Porter Studios in ...

4.

Dead Men Tell

1941 film by Harry Lachman

Overview: Dead Men Tell is a 1941 American mystery film starring Sidney Toler, who played Charlie Chan in 22 feature films, beginning with Charlie Chan in Honolulu (1938), and ending with The Trap (1946). The first ...

Release date: 28 March 1941

Genre: Mystery, Comedy, Crime, Thriller

Director: Harry Lachman

A treasure map in four pieces, the ghost of a hanged pirate, a talking parrot, and a shipful of red herrings complicate Charlie's search for a murderer ...

0 0

7.

The Shanghai Cobra

1945 film

Overview: The Shanghai Cobra is a 1945 mystery film directed by Phil Karlson and starring Sidney Toler as Charlie Chan.

Release date: 1 August 1945

Genre: Mystery, Comedy, Crime, Drama, Thriller

Director: Phil Karlson

Someone is attempting to steal radium stored in a bank. Cobra bites lead to a number of murders. Charlie investigates.

The Black Camel

1931 film

Overview: The Black Camel is a 1931 American pre-Code mystery film directed by Hamilton MacFadden and starring Warner Oland, Sally Eilers, Bela Lugosi, and Dorothy Revier. It is based on the 1929 novel of the same ...

Release date: 21 June 1931

Genre: Crime, Drama, Horror, Mystery, Thriller

Director: Hamilton MacFadden

The unsolved murder of a Hollywood actor several years earlier and an enigmatic psychic are the keys to help Charlie solve the Honolulu stabbing death ...

9.

Charlie Chan on Broadway

1937 film by Eugene Forde

Overview: Charlie Chan on Broadway (1937) is a Charlie Chan film. This is the 15th film starring Oland as Chan and produced by Fox.

Release date: 18 September 1937

Genre: Comedy, Crime, Mystery, Thriller

Director: Eugene Forde

Producer: John Stone

Returning from European exile where she avoided testifying against her criminal associates, a former singer with a tell-all diary is murdered to insure ...

10.

Charlie Chan in the Chinese Cat

1944 film by Phil Rosen

Overview: The Chinese Cat (also titled Murder in the Funhouse) is a 1944 mystery film starring Sidney Toler as Charlie Chan.

Release date: 20 May 1944

Genre: Drama, Mystery, Comedy, Crime, Thriller

Director: Phil Rosen

Charlie Chan investigates the locked-room murder of a chess expert.

0 0

11.

Charlie Chan in Reno

1939 film by Norman Foster

Overview: Charlie Chan in Reno is a 1939 American film directed by Norman Foster, starring Sidney Toler as the fictional Chinese-American detective Charlie Chan, based on an original story "Death Makes a Decree" ...

Release date: 31 May 1939

Genre: Drama, Mystery, Crime, Comedy, Thriller

Director: Norman Foster

Producer: John Stone

Mary Whitman, an old friend of Charlie's in Reno for a divorce, finds herself accused of murdering the woman her husband planned to marry after the decree ...

Charlie Chan in London

1934 American mystery film directed by Eugene Forde

Overview: Charlie Chan in London is a 1934 American mystery film directed by Eugene Forde. The film stars Warner Oland as Charlie Chan. This is the sixth film produced by Fox with Warner Oland as the detective ...

Release date: 12 September 1934

Genre: Crime, Drama, Mystery, Thriller

Director: Eugene Forde

Charlie visits a wealthy country home in England. Suspects in the murder range from a housekeepe to a stableman to a lawyer.

Release date: 30 December 1938

Genre: Comedy, Mystery, Crime, Thriller, Horror

While Charlie is distracted with the birth of his first grandchild, son Jimmy impersonates his father in order to investigate a murder aboard a freighter ...

Charlie Chan in City in Darkness

1939 US film by Herbert I. Leeds

Overview: Charlie Chan in City in Darkness, also titled City in Darkness, is a 1939 mystery film starring Sidney Toler in his fourth performance as detective Charlie Chan.

Release date: 15 November 1939

Genre: Drama, Mystery, Thriller

While in Paris for a reunion on the eve of World War II, Charlie finds that the murder of an hated businessman leads him to a conspiracy to smuggle arms ...

1931 film

Release date: 12 April 1931

Genre: Mystery, Comedy, Crime

Director: Hamilton MacFadden

Charlie steps in to solve the murder of a wealthy American found dead in a London hotel. Settings include London...

Charlie Chan at the Race Track

1936 film by H. Bruce Humberstone

Overview: Charlie Chan at the Race Track is the 12th film in the 20th Century Fox-produced Charlie Chan series starring Warner Oland in the title role.

Release date: 14 August 1936

Genre: Comedy, Crime, Mystery, Sport, Thriller

Charlie Chan at the Opera

1936 film by H. Bruce Humberstone

Overview: Charlie Chan at the Opera is considered by many to be the best Warner Oland Charlie Chan film, probably due to the presence of Boris Karloff as the principal suspect, as well as faux operatic music composed ...

Release date: 5 December 1936

Genre: Comedy, Musical, Mystery, Thriller, Drama

A dangerous amnesiac escapes from an asylum, hides in the opera house, and is suspected of getting revenge on those who tried to murder him 13 years ago ...

19.

Charlie Chan and the Curse of the Dragon Queen

1981 film directed by Clive Donner

Overview: Charlie Chan and the Curse of the Dragon Queen is a 1981 comedy–mystery film directed by Clive Donner that stars Peter Ustinov, Angie Dickinson and Lee Grant.

Release date: 1 February 1981

Genre: Comedy, Mystery

Director: Clive Donner

Detective Charlie Chan helps SFPD solve the many bizarre murders. His clumsy grandson Lee, who's getting married, "helps" him. Is the Dragon Queen ...
